unnormalised: From Mumbai to Bangalore, it seems like everyone and their ajji is suddenly hitting the gym. Remember when working out was just for athletes and maybe the occasional Bollywood hero? Now it's become a lifestyle, almost a status symbol.
normalised: From Mumbai to Bangalore, it seems like everyone and their ajji is suddenly hitting the gym. Remember when working out was just for athletes and maybe the occasional Bollywood hero? Now it's become a lifestyle, almost a status symbol.

unnormalised: You see these fancy gyms popping up everywhere – like "Fitness First" in Indiranagar, or "Cult.fit" in Bandra - all boasting state-of-the-art equipment, HIIT classes, yoga studios, and smoothie bars. It's a far cry from the local akhada your grandpa used to go to! People are paying serious Rs. to become members - I've heard some go upto Rs. 20,000 per month.

unnormalised: But is it all just hype? Well, some of it is definitely fuelled by Instagram and the desire to look good in your selfies. But I think there's a genuine shift happening.
